description: Used to describe a phenotype that characterizes the subject or biosample.

evidence.description: The evidence for an assertion of the observation of a type. RECOMMENDED.

excluded.description: Flag to indicate whether the phenotypic feature was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the phenotype was observed. Therefore it is only used in cases where the phenotype was looked for but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the `featureType` field. CAUTION: It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the phenotype! Source: Phenopackets v2

featureType.description: Term denoting the phenotypic feature, preferably using a value from Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)

modifiers.description: This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. Example use here would be one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). Source: Phenopackets v2

notes.description: Unstructured text to describe additional properties of this phenotypic feature.

onset.description: Age or time at which the feature was first observed.

resolution.description: Age or time at which the feature resolved or abated.

title: PhenotypicFeature
